disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Moderate ozone air pollution forecast valid from Friday 17 June to end of Friday 17 June GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Hot weather is forecast for Greater London on Friday, with temperatures reaching the low to mid-30s by late afternoon.<br/><br/>The high temperatures will promote further formation of ground-level ozone as locally emitted and longer-range pollutants react photochemically. 'Moderate' levels of ozone are therefore expected to occur during the afternoon and evening at background and suburban locations away from busy roads. <br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' for the following pollutants throughout the forecast period:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/>

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Saturday 18 June to end of Saturday 18 June GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Lower temperatures than of late are forecast for Saturday as Greater London is affected by a weather front arriving from the Atlantic.<br/><br/>With cooler weather and a 'cleaner' incoming maritime air feed, the potential for ground-level ozone formation will be reduced. This should bring about an easing of conditions after the ozone pollution episodes that affected London during the previous working week.   <br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' for the following pollutants throughout the forecast period:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Ozone<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/>
